hero.title: Contribute to Math Library
hero.subtitle: Help build and improve our mathematical knowledge base. We welcome contributions from mathematicians, educators, and learners.

content.text: Math Library is built by its community. Here are the main ways you can contribute:
Found a typo, unclear explanation, or error? Help us improve!

items: Update references or add new citations

content.text: Interested in writing for Math Library? We welcome:

items: New lessons or modules for existing courses
Entirely new courses or learning paths
Blog articles on mathematics or pedagogy

articles.title: Share Resources
articles.content: Know of excellent books, papers, or resources that should be referenced? Share them with us. We're always looking for quality materials to recommend.

articles.title: Participate in Discussion
articles.content: Ask questions, answer others, and share insights in our Discussion forum. Community engagement strengthens everyone's learning.

articles.title: Report Issues
articles.content: Found a broken link, confusing explanation, or technical problem? Report it on GitHub or email us. These reports help us maintain quality.

articles.title: Suggest Features or Topics
articles.content: Have ideas for new courses or ways to improve the platform? We'd love to hear them. Discussion about future directions is always welcome.

articles.title: Clarity First
articles.content: Write for understanding. Use clear, concrete language. Explain technical terms. Build from first principles.

articles.title: Rigor Matters
articles.content: Be mathematically precise. Definitions should be clear. Claims should be justified. Proofs should be sound.

articles.title: Structure for Discovery
articles.content: Use clear headings, logical organization, and appropriate emphasis. Readers should understand the structure at a glance.

articles.title: Cite Your Sources
articles.content: Reference where ideas come from. This honors those who came before and helps readers explore further.

articles.title: Permanence in Mind
articles.content: Write for longevity. Avoid trendy language or examples that will quickly become dated. Focus on enduring principles.

content.text: Ready to contribute? Here's how to get started:

items: Contact us at Ake.coe.aki@gmail.com with a brief description of what you'd like to contribute
We'll respond with feedback and discuss scope and style
You'll write your contribution, keeping our guidelines in mind
We'll review your work and provide constructive feedback
Once finalized, we'll integrate your contribution into Math Library

content.text: All contributors are credited for their work. Depending on the contribution, you may receive:

items: Author attribution on the contributed content
A profile in our community contributors section
Links to your personal site or social media

content.text: Math Library exists because people care about mathematical knowledge. We're grateful for every contribution, no matter how small. Together, we're building a permanent resource for mathematics.
